newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine Jan-Nov foreign currency deals $18.5 bln.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine Jan-Nov foreign currency deals $18.5 bln.

text.p: Foreign currency transactions on Ukrainian markets reached $18.5 billion for the first 11 months of this year, exceeding volumes for all of 1995, the central bank official in charge of foreign currency reserves said on Tuesday.

Foreign currency transactions on the Ukraine Interbank Currency Exchange (UICE), the interbank market, international transactions by banks, and buying and selling of currency at street exchange points reached $9.2 billion in 1995.
"We predict that December volumes will be the highest of all in 1996, just like December of 1995 had the highest volumes," Mykola Melnychuk told Reuters.
Transactions in December 1995 totalled $1.098 billion, central bank statistics said.
The increase in transactions was due to a rise in interbank trading and growing international banking deals, Melnychuk said.
Volumes on the UICE, where the rate of the hryvnia is set daily, reached $2.22 billion for the first 11 months of this year compared to $3.73 billion for the same period last year.
The hryvnia was unchanged at 1.886 to the dollar on the UICE on Tuesday.
Melnychuk said transactions on the UICE had risen since the central bank stopped intervening on the interbank market on December 9 to boost the hryvnia.
